short_description: This function gives a predict label for each input sample according to the pre-trained SVM model table.
long_description: This function predicts input samples for dense input format.  The model is trained by DenseSvmTrainer, and it is used to give one or more  predicts according to the confidence value for each sample.

input_tables.name: model
input_tables.rDescription: The model table generated by SVMTrainer.
input_tables.description: The model table generated by SVMTrainer.

argument_clauses.name: InputColumns
argument_clauses.rDescription: Input table columns that contain the attributes of the test samples. Attribute columns must be numeric (int, real, bigint, smallint, or float).
argument_clauses.description: Input table columns that contain the attributes of the test samples. Attribute columns must be numeric (int, real, bigint, smallint, or float).

argument_clauses.name: IdColumn
argument_clauses.rDescription: Name of the input table column that contains the identifiers of the test samples.
argument_clauses.description: Name of the input table column that contains the identifiers of the test samples.

argument_clauses.name: Accumulate
argument_clauses.rDescription: Columns to be copied from the input table to the output table.
argument_clauses.description: Columns to be copied from the input table to the output table.

argument_clauses.name: OutputClassNum
argument_clauses.rDescription: Only valid for multiple class models. If the value of this argument is k, the output table will include k class labels with corresponding predict_confidence instead of a single predicted result. The input value must be no less than 1. The default value is 1.
argument_clauses.description: Only valid for multiple class models. If the value of this argument is k, the output table will include k class labels with corresponding predict_confidence instead of a single predicted result. The input value must be no less than 1. The default value is 1.

argument_clauses.name: SequenceInputBy
argument_clauses.rDescription: Specifies the LIST_VECTOR of column(s) that uniquely identifies each row of the input argument INPUT_ARG_NAME. The argument is used to ensure deterministic results for functions which produce results that vary from run to run.
argument_clauses.description: Specifies the input column(s) that uniquely identify each row of input table. The format is 'input1:c1' where input1 refers to the alias used by the input table that contains such column named c1.
